DataElement.preferredName: Participant Health Care Provider Communication Skin Self-Examination Method Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of exchange of information by persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities on techniques for the inspection of a participant's own skin for abnormalities that could be cancerous.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Health Care Provider Communication Skin Self-Examination Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Exchange of information by persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities on techniques for the inspection of one's own skin for abnormalities that could be cancerous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.:the exchange of information between objects, people, or groups.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.
The exchange of information between objects, people, or groups.

Property.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:inspection of one's own body, usually for signs of disease.:The mode or manner or orderly sequence of events of a process or procedure. (from STED98)

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The inspection of one's own body, usually for signs of disease.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Method/frequency of thorough
ReferenceDocuments.description: Method/frequency of thorough skin self-examination date

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Arizona Cancer Center adoption of C3D.
